## Books * Andy Baker (2022). [*Shaping the Developing World: The South, the West, and the Natural World: Second Edition.*](https://us.sagepub.com/en-us/nam/shaping-the-developing-world/book249551) Washington, D.C.: Congressional Quarterly Press. [[Request a review copy.]](https://us.sagepub.com/en-us/nam/shaping-the-developing-world/book249551) [[First Edition, 2014]](https://us.sagepub.com/en-us/nam/shaping-the-developing-world/book237495) * Andy Baker, Barry Ames, and Lucio Renno (2020). [*Persuasive Peers: Social Communication and Voting in Latin America.*](https://press.princeton.edu/books/paperback/9780691205779/persuasive-peers) [Online appendices and replication materials.](https://doi.org/10.7910/DVN/I8VV7Z) * Winner of the 2021 APSA Political Networks Section Best Book Award, awarded every other year for the best book published in the past two years. * Portuguese translation: *Pares Persuasivos: Comunicação social e votação na América Latina* (2023). Brasília: Editora Universidade de Brasília. * Reviewed in the following: * *Perspectives on Politics* * *Latin American Research Review* * *Bulletin of Latin American Research* * Andy Baker (2009). [*The Market and the Masses in Latin America: Policy Reform and Consumption in Liberalizing Economies.*](https://doi.org/10.1017/CBO9780511576447) (Cambridge Studies in Comparative Politics). New York: Cambridge University Press. * Blog post: [Monkey Cage](https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/monkey-cage/wp/2014/06/02/latin-americans-are-embracing-globalization-and-their-former-colonial-masters/?utm_term=.03412b47947a) * Reviewed in the following: * *Perspectives on Politics* * *Comparative Political Studies* * *International Journal of Public Opinion Research* * *Latin American Research Review* * *Latin American Politics and Society* * *Bulletin of Latin American Research* * *Choice Reviews Online* ----
